$comment: This schema includes deprecated-but-handled-by-augur-export-v1 properties, but their schema definitions are somewhat incomplete
title: Auspice config file to be supplied to `augur export v2`

___updated.description: DEPRECATED v1 (or older) syntax for defining when the build was updated

___geo_resolutions.description: Traits to be interpreted as 'geo resolution' options -- i.e. associated with lat/longs & made points on the map
___geo_resolutions.$comment: Note that array entries can be different structures & you can mix & match

___key.description: Trait key - must be specified on nodes (e.g. 'country')

___title.description: The title to display in the geo resolution dropdown. Optional -- if not provided then `key` will be used.
Title to be displayed in auspice

___build_url.description: URL with instructions to reproduce build, usually expected to be a GitHub repo URL

___geo.description: DEPRECATED v1 syntax for defining geo_resolutions

___colorings.description: Set traits to be available as color-dropdown options

___key.description: They key used to access the value of this coloring on each node

___type.description: Defines how the color scale should be constructed

___title.description: Text to be displayed in the "color by" dropdown and legends
___title.$comment: string is parsed unchanged by Auspice

___color_options.description: DEPRECATED v1 syntax for defining colorings

___maintainer.description: DEPRECATED v1 syntax for defining maintainers (but you could only define one!)

___defaults.description: DEPRECATED v1 syntax for defining auspice view defaults

___vaccine_choices.description: UNUSED v1 syntax for defining vaccine choices
___vaccine_choices.$comment: This is unused in `augur export v2` which gets vaccine info vis a node-data JSON file. It remains in the schema so that v1 config files can be used by `augur export v2`
